variants.name: example
variants.notes: Start by adding an element with element of `<Grid>`. This will create a horizontal block to contain vertical columns. Then add `<GridColumn>` elements within that row. Specify the widths of each column with `width={['xs-#', 'sm-#', 'md-#', 'lg-#']}` classes. Responsive modifiers enable specifying different column sizes, offsets, alignment and distribution at xs, sm, md & lg viewport widths. Bare in mind that **the layout is mobile-first**. You can stack modifiers if you want to achieve different alignment depending on screen size.

variants.name: vertical-align
variants.notes: Vertical alignment can be either adjusted separately column by column using `align={['top-#', 'middle-#', 'bottom-#']}` (example below) or by whole group of columns by using grid modifier `align={['top-#', 'middle-#', 'bottom-#']}`.

variants.name: horizontal-align
variants.notes: Horizontal alignment can be adjusted by whole group of columns using grid modifier `justify={['start-#', 'center-#', 'end-#', 'between-#', 'around-#']}`.

variants.name: equalheight
variants.notes: Make grid colums with equal height by using grid modifier `equalHeight={true}`.

variants.name: gutter
variants.notes: Use columns without gutter by using grid modifier `gutter="none"`.

variants.name: offset
variants.notes: Move columns to the right using `offset={['sm-#']}` classes. These classes increase the left margin of a column by # columns.

variants.name: order
variants.notes: You can reverse order by using `reverse={['#']}` modifier or control column directly via `order={['first-#', 'last-#', 'original-#']}`.
